thread.title: Iran 1979: a time of revolution – in pictures
thread.title_full: Iran 1979: a time of revolution – in pictures

author: Saeed Kamali Dehghan
title: Iran 1979: a time of revolution – in pictures
text:
Iran 1979: a time of revolution – in pictures Iran 1979: a time of revolution – in pictures View more sharing options Share on Messenger Close 
The Observer photographer David Newell Smith visited Iran in 1979, when Ayatollah Khomeini returned to Tehran from exile in Paris, ending the Shah’s rule. On the revolution’s anniversary, the Guardian’s Iran correspondent, Saeed Kamali Dehghan, chooses a selection of his photos Friday 10 February 2017 08.28 GMT A group of women waiting in Tehran city centre for a taxi Photograph: David Newell Smith for the Observer Central bank (where the crown jewels were kept), Tehran Photograph: David Newell Smith for the Observer Handbags for sale, Tehran Photograph: David Newell Smith for the Observer Students outside a school in central Tehran Photograph: David Newell Smith for the Observer Streetscape in Tehran Photograph: David Newell Smith for the Observer A streetside stall, Tehran Photograph: David Newell Smith for the Observer Men looking in the window of an underwear shop, Tehran Photograph: David Newell Smith for the Observer People visiting the Shahyad monument, Tehran Photograph: David Newell Smith for the Observer Women in central Tehran Photograph: David Newell Smith for the Observer Topics
